item.title: Congress approves Jeffrey Epstein files bill, sending it to Trump to sign
item.description: President Donald Trump, a former Epstein friend who fell out with him, recently dropped his opposition to the bipartisan bill to release the files.

item.title: Trump, Saudi Crown Prince bin Salman brush off criticism of Khashoggi killing
item.description: The White House touted Saudi Arabia's commitment to investing $600 billion in the United States, which was announced earlier this year.

item.title: Trump calls for ABC's license to be revoked after reporter asks about Jeffrey Epstein files
item.description: Trump insulted ABC News reporter Mary Bruce days after telling a female reporter to be "quiet, piggy," when she asked about Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Court blocks Texas from using new congressional map backed by Republicans
item.description: A federal court in Texas Tuesday blocked Texas from using a new congressional map intended to flip several Democratic-held U.S. House of Representativ...

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein files: House speaker announces vote next week on release of docs
item.description: The Trump administration has been criticized for failing to release files about convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, a former friend of President T...
